snippet: At 14, a diagnosis of lupus led Emie Payen to conclude she had only 20 years to live. Despite a rash of other health problems, she is still coping 41 years later.
abstract: Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens, one of seven agencies supported by the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, provides Emie Payen with $600 to pay down rent arrears; Payen has struggled as a single mother with lupus and other health problems.
lead_paragraph: At 14, a diagnosis of lupus led Emie Payen to conclude she had only 20 years to live. Despite a rash of other health problems, she is still coping 41 years later.
